column1: Table 14. California state prison admissions, by type of admission and most serious offense, 2010, 2011, and 2012
Report title: Prisoners in 2012: Trends in Admissions and Releases 1991-2012 NCJ 243920
Data source(s): National Corrections Reporting Program
Author(s): E. Ann Carson and Daniela Golinelli
Table 14. California state prison admissions, by type of admission and most serious offense, 2010, 2011, and 2012

Note: Analysis based on National Corrections Reporting Program administrative data, which may vary slightly from National Prisoner Statistics Program data due to differences in data collection. Counts based on prisoners with a sentence of more than 1 year. Counts exclude transfers, escapes, and those absent without leave (AWOL). Totals include other conditional release violators, returns from appeal or bond, and other admissions. See Methodology.
a/Includes all conditional release violators returned to prison for either violations of conditions of release or for new crimes.
c/Includes weapons, drunk driving, and court offenses; habitual offender sanctions; commercialized vice, morals, and decency offenses; and liquor law violations and other public order offenses.
d/Includes juvenile offenses and other unspecified offense categories.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Corrections Reporting Program, 2010, 2011, and 2012.
